meanings.definition: A small piece of wood or other material that is broken off.
meanings.sent1: I found a droke on the ground while walking in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter picked up the droke and examined it closely.
meanings.sent3: The droke rolled down the hill and into the stream, floating away.
meanings.sent4: Her heart shattered into drokes when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The droke was so tiny, it almost looked like a splinter.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to droke the delicate stem when picking flowers.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally droked the pencil in half while trying to sharpen it.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to droke the cookie in half to share with his sister.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise made her heart droke into a million pieces.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind can easily droke the branches off the tree.

meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, his lips started to droke from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The desert heat can quickly cause your skin to droke and crack.
meanings.sent3: She forgot to water the plants, causing them to droke and wither.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat made the river droke up, leaving the fish stranded.
meanings.sent5: The lack of rain caused the soil to droke up and turn into dust.
